column3: Feel free to take over https://github.com/laanwj/bitcoin/tree/2018_05_logprintf_remove_return_value, which removes the unused and incorrect return value from LogPrintstr and has this commit rebased on top.\n
@laanwj Nice cleanup! Added that commit to this PR.

I don't think this patch is really correct -- in the usual failure case where the old file handle is closed, but a new file can't be (re)opened (due to permissions, eg), we'll silently drop the current log message, then start writing any future log messages to the m_msgs_before_open buffer, which will never be cleared. Am I missing something?\n\nIf I'm not, seems like better behaviour might be s
